observations: Input and output grids have the same dimensions.
The 5s in the input grid remain unchanged in the output grid.
Rows above the middle row of 5s are transformed to have identical rows.
Rows below the middle row of 5s are transformed to have identical rows.
The first three columns above the row of 5s become identical.
The last three columns below the row of 5s become identical.
Values other than 5 are transformed into one of a few distinct values above and below the row of 5s.
hypotheses: The top rows are transformed such that the first three columns of each row are the same, and the last values are copied from the input. The bottom rows are transformed similarly.

The grid is divided horizontally by the row of 5s. Above, each of the first three columns in each row takes the value of the mean of the first three columns. Below, the last three columns in each row take the mean of the last three columns.

Each row above the middle row of 5s is replaced with a row containing the values of the first row in its first three positions repeated, with remaining values derived from existing values. The same pattern is applied to rows below the row of 5s, but using the last row.
The 5s remain unchanged. The top and bottom sections are averaged to generate 3 identical rows each.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The top rows are transformed such that the first three columns of each row are the same, and the last values are copied from the input. The bottom rows are transformed similarly.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: The rightmost values above the line of 5s are not copied directly from the input grid, they change depending on their position.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: The grid is divided horizontally by the row of 5s. Above, each of the first three columns in each row takes the value of the mean of the first three columns. Below, the last three columns in each row take the mean of the last three columns.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Averaging does not account for all the resulting values. Example 1 would result in 2.3 repeating, but the output contains clean integers.

selected_rule: Divide the grid horizontally by the row of 5s. Above, the first three columns of each row are identical. Below, the last three columns in each row are identical. Values other than 5 in the input are used as a base for the values in the output grid.
step_plan: For rows above, make the first three columns of each row the same as the first three entries of the first row in that section.
For rows below, make the last three columns of each row the same as the last three entries of the last row in that section.
Leave the 5s in the original position.
